===Cause and prevalence===
===Cause and prevalence===
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.
Virtually no research has been conducted regarding the prevalence of necrophilic attraction among humans. Klaf and Brown<ref name="klaf">Klaf, Franklin S., and Brown, William (1958). "Necrophilia: Brief Review and Case Report," ''the Psychoanalytic Quarterly'', 29(143), 645-652. "Inhibited forms of necrophilia and necrophilic fantasies may occur more commonly then is generally realized."</ref> (1958) commented that, although rarely described, necrophilic fantasies may occur more often than is generally supposed.

== Jorge Gurden ==
  +   +
Possibly the most extreme necrophile is the infamous Jorge Gurden of Bayston Hill, Shrewsbury (Full address here). He has a criminal record in 4 different countries, all for the molestation of the deceased. He was convicted and fined â¬2000 for necrophiliac rape; in Germany 2004. He is a well educated individual, from studying at the University of Liverpool for 3 years. As well as being attracted to corpses, he also has a fetish for High-Defenition televisions and miscellania. He recently traded in his PS2 for a Nintendo Wii, for reasons unknown (he also has two kidneys and a pet hard-disc). He is well known by the West Mercia Police and is believed to have severe schizophrenia. What is certain, is that he is a bit of a mongaloid and is insanely perverted. Do not approach, unless armed with cattle prod.
